comments: a(n) = 1111 in base n.n^3 + n^2 + n + 1 = (n^2 + 1)*(n + 1), therefore a(n) is never prime. - _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 22 2014
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: Table[n^3 + n^2 + n + 1, {n, 0, 39}] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 22 2014 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n^3 + n^2 + n + 1: n in [0..50]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, May 01, 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 23 2000
